isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVE TRAIN - Component Reassembly - Cylinder Heads

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, make sure cylinder head and head gasket are clean and free of debris. A contaminated seal between the cylinder head and gasket can lead to oil, coolant, and compression leakage. Do not apply sealer to head gasket surfaces.
Threads in crankcase bolt holes must be clean and blown dry with filtered compressed air. Dirt or oil left in holes may cause binding and false torque reading during assembly.

step1.para: If not done, clean all cylinder head bolt holes with a Head Bolt Bottoming Tap and remove debris with filtered compressed air.

figure.caption: Figure 183. Old cylinder head (eight tapped M8 holes)
Figure 184. New cylinder head (two tapped M8 holes)

step1.para: Make sure two cylinder head dowel sleeves are installed (one at front and one at rear of crankcase).

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

caution.para: Threads in crankcase bolt holes must be clean and blown dry with filtered compressed air. Dirt or oil left in holes may cause binding or a false torque reading during assembly.

To prevent engine damage, make sure cylinder head and head gasket are clean and free of debris. A contaminated seal between the cylinder head and gasket can lead to oil, coolant, and compression leakage. Do not apply sealer to head gasket surfaces.
To prevent engine damage, install a new cylinder head gasket with part number facing up. Make sure the top five bolt holes and head gasket push rod holes line up.

note.para: Use care to avoid scratching blue compound on cylinder head gaskets.

step1.para: Align new cylinder head gasket with spring dowel pins and press to install.

note.para: Cam followers cannot be removed or replaced when cylinder head is bolted to the crankcase. Be sure to complete required work on cam followers, before installing cylinder head.

figure.caption: Figure 186. Installation cylinder head lifting bracket

step1.para: Install Cylinder Head Lifting Bracket in center of cylinder head. Tighten bracket mounting bolts.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not drop or slide cylinder head on head gasket.

step1.para: Attach hoist hook or lifting sling to lifting bracket.
Raise cylinder head and position to align with dowel sleeves previously installed in crankcase, and lower onto gasket.

calloutgroup.callout1: M8 x 70 bolt - cylinder head to crankcase (2 of 5)

step1.para: Install two outer M8 x 70 bolts - cylinder head to crankcase. Run threads down until finger tight.
Remove hoist latch from cylinder head lifting bracket.

figure.caption: Figure 189. Installation of middle M8 x 70 bolts

step1.para: Install three middle M8 x 70 bolts - cylinder head to crankcase. Run threads down until finger tight.
